original: Landau, Albin, stadsdistriktsläkare, Göteborg, f. 22/3/99 i Sthlm av Jacob L. o. Fredrique Dimant. G. 29 m. gymn:dir. Barbro Wadlund. Barn: Karin f. 32, Rolf 35. — Stud :ex. 16, med. kand. 19 o. med. lic. 24, allt i Sthlm. E. o. aman. v. Karol. inst. patolog. inst. sex mån., tf. und :läk. v. Flens las. 22, assist :läk. v. Örebro las. tills, fyra mån. 24-26, tf. aman. v. Kronpr. Lovisas vårdanst. kir. avd. 25, assist :läk. v. barnsjukh. Samariten 26, und :läk. v. Arvika sanat. 26-27, assist :-läk. o. aman. v. Gbgs barnsjukh. med. avd. tills, femton mån. 26-29, bitr. läk. där 29-31, fartygsläk. på Gripsholm två resor 30-31, bitr. läk. v. Gbgs epid:- 5t)0sjiikh. 31-33, tf. stadsdistr :läk. i Gbg 33 o. numera ^stadsdistr :läk., skolläk. v. Majornas h. a. 1. o. prakt, mellansk. Marinläk :stip. över stat 23-25, marin-läk. av andra gr. i res. 25, av första gr. 38. Stud:resor 28 q. 29. Skr.: ett 20-tal arb. i inv. med. o. pediatr.
translated: Landau, Albin, district physician, Gothenburg, b. 22/3/99 in Stockholm to Jacob L. and Fredrique Dimant. Married in 1929 to gymnastics director Barbro Wadlund. Children: Karin b. 1932, Rolf b. 1935. Education: graduated from high school in 1916, obtained medical bachelor's degree in 1919, and medical license in 1924, all in Stockholm. Worked as an assistant at the Karolinska Institute Pathological Institute for six months, then as a temporary physician at Flens Hospital in 1922, and as an assistant physician at Örebro Hospital for four months from 1924-1926. Was a temporary assistant at the Crown Princess Lovisa Care Institution Surgical Department in 1925, and an assistant physician at Samariten Children's Hospital in 1926. Worked as an attending physician at Arvika Sanatorium from 1926-1927, and as an assistant physician and assistant at the Gothenburg Children's Hospital Medical Department for fifteen months from 1926-1929, then as an assistant doctor there from 1929-1931. Served as a ship's doctor on the Gripsholm ship for two trips in 1930-1931, and as an assistant physician at Gothenburg Epidemic Hospital from 1931-1933. Became a temporary district physician in Gothenburg in 1933 and is currently a district physician and school doctor at Majorna High School. Also works as a general practitioner. Received a naval medical scholarship from 1923-1925, and became a naval medical officer of the second class in 1925, and the first class in 1938. Went on study trips in 1928 and 1929. Has written about twenty works in internal medicine and pediatrics.
